issues.title: Deploy Base Prometheus Stack
issues.body:
Deploy a Prometheus stack for scraping metrics from orchestrator, bench hosts, workers, and CI runners.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Prometheus instance(s) deployed and reachable in the dev environment.
- Scrape configs include targets for orchestrator, bench hosts, workers, and CI runners.
- Prometheus UI accessible via internal URL and returning metrics.
- Retention settings configured for 30-day hot storage.

**Notes**
- Use operator or EC2-hosted approach depending on infra constraints.

issues.title: Configure Loki Log Ingestion Pipeline
issues.body:
Deploy and configure Loki for structured JSON log ingestion and querying.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Loki deployed and reachable in dev environment.
- Log ingestion configured via OTEL/agent and validated for at least one service.
- Required labels present on logs: `correlation_id`, `bench_id`, `environment`, `team`.
- Queries return structured JSON fields and sample log retention policy is set.

issues.title: Implement OpenTelemetry Collector Pipeline
issues.body:
Deploy OTEL Collector to centralize metrics, logs, and traces and export to Prometheus, Loki, and Jaeger/X-Ray.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- OTEL Collector deployed with receivers for metrics, logs, and traces.
- Exporters configured: Prometheus remote-write (or scrape), Loki, Jaeger/X-Ray.
- Batching and sampling policies present and documented.
- Collector accepts test telemetry and forwards to backends without data loss.

issues.title: Integrate Python OpenTelemetry SDK in Orchestrator
issues.body:
Add tracing instrumentation to the orchestrator using the Python OTEL SDK to ensure end-to-end traceability.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Instrumentation wrapper added to API, scheduler, and dispatch paths.
- Standardized span names and attributes documented and used.
- Correlation IDs are generated/propagated and visible in traces and logs.
- A sample execution produces a complete trace visible in Jaeger/X-Ray.

issues.title: Bench Host Exporter Configuration
issues.body:
Install and configure exporters/agents on bench hosts to expose host and bench-specific metrics.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Node exporter or CloudWatch agent deployed on all bench hosts.
- Metrics include CPU, memory, disk, network, bench.status, and bench-specific custom metrics.
- Prometheus successfully scrapes bench hosts and metrics appear in the UI.
- Exporter overhead measured and confirmed <2% CPU on bench hosts.

issues.title: Publish Execution Metrics for Test Runs
issues.body:
Implement and expose metrics for test execution: success rate, duration, failure types, labeled by bench_id and test_suite.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Metrics published: `execution.duration_seconds`, `execution.success_rate`, `worker.task_failures_total`.
- Labels present: `bench_id`, `test_suite`, `commit_sha`, `environment`.
- Metrics scraped by Prometheus and appear on sample queries.
- Sample dashboards can visualize these metrics.

issues.title: Create Bench Operations Dashboard (Grafana)
issues.body:
Create Grafana dashboard focused on bench availability, utilization, and queue length with 15s refresh for critical panels.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Dashboard contains panels for bench availability, in-use vs idle, queue length, and current alerts.
- Panels refresh within 15s for critical metrics.
- Panels link to logs/traces for drill-down.
- Dashboard JSON committed to `dashboards/` and validated by CI.

issues.title: Create Queue and Execution Dashboard
issues.body:
Create Grafana dashboard showing queue latency, execution latency (p50/p90/p99), success rates, and flaky-test trends.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Panels for p50/p90/p99 execution duration, queue latency, and success rate implemented.
- Error heatmap and flaky-test trend panels present and queryable.
- Each failing test panel links to logs/traces for RCA.

issues.title: Configure Basic Alert Rules (P1/P2)
issues.body:
Create Prometheus alert rules for P1/P2 conditions and route them to Alertmanager integrations (Slack/SNS/PagerDuty).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Alert rules implemented for bench offline, queue length threshold, and elevated failure rate.
- Alerts route to Slack/SNS and include severity tags.
- Alert firing verified with synthetic telemetry.
- Alerts documented in `alerting/` and validated by CI.

issues.title: Author Initial Runbooks for P1/P2 Alerts
issues.body:
Create concise runbooks for the P1 and P2 alerts with validation, mitigation, and escalation steps.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Runbooks present in `docs/RUNBOOK.md` covering each alert in scope.
- Each runbook contains quick checks, mitigation steps, and PagerDuty escalation path.
- Runbooks reviewed and approved by on-call owner.

issues.title: Implement Log Schema Validation in CI
issues.body:
Add CI lint/validation that ensures logs include required fields and follow JSON schema.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- GitHub Actions job validates log JSON schema for required fields: `timestamp`, `correlation_id`, `service`, `bench_id`.
- PRs with invalid log schema fail the CI job.
- Documentation added on required log format.

issues.title: CI Pipeline: Dashboard and Alert Validation
issues.body:
Add GitHub Actions jobs to validate Grafana dashboard JSON and Prometheus alert rule syntax on PRs.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- GitHub Actions job validates Grafana JSON structure and queries for syntax errors.
- Alert rule YAML is linted and tested for proper label/expr presence.
- PRs with invalid artifacts fail the checks.

issues.title: Create Terraform/Helm Modules for Observability
issues.body:
Implement reusable Terraform modules or Helm charts for Prometheus, Loki, and OTEL collector deployments.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Modules/charts created in `helm/` or `terraform/` with variables for retention and endpoints.
- Modules tested via `terraform plan`/`helm template` in dev.
- Documentation on usage and variables added.

issues.title: Enable S3 Backup for Loki/Prometheus Snapshots
issues.body:
Configure snapshotting and archival to S3 with lifecycle policies for hot→cold retention.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Snapshot policy configured for Prometheus and Loki to S3.
- S3 lifecycle rules set to transition to Glacier per retention policy.
- Restore test performed to validate snapshots.

issues.title: Create Correlation-ID Injection Middleware
issues.body:
Implement middleware to generate and propagate correlation IDs across services when missing.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Middleware injects a `correlation_id` if request does not include one.
- Correlation ID is propagated through headers, logs, metrics, and traces.
- Verified with end-to-end synthetic request producing logs/traces with same ID.

issues.title: Trace Linking: Orchestrator → Worker → Runner
issues.body:
Ensure traces link across orchestrator, worker, and runner to form a single end-to-end trace for executions.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Spans from orchestrator, worker, and runner appear under one trace in Jaeger/X-Ray for sample runs.
- Trace contains expected span names and attributes including `bench_id` and `correlation_id`.
- Documentation of span conventions added to `docs/`.

issues.title: Document Observability Architecture and Diagrams
issues.body:
Update README and architecture diagrams to reflect implemented components and data flows.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Architecture diagram updated in `docs/` and linked from README.
- Component responsibilities and data flows documented.
- Documentation reviewed and merged.

issues.title: Integration Test: Synthetic Execution Telemetry
issues.body:
Implement a synthetic test that generates execution telemetry (metrics, logs, traces) to validate end-to-end flow.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Synthetic job emits metrics, logs, and traces through OTEL collector.
- Data appears in Prometheus, Loki, and Jaeger/X-Ray dashboards.
- CI job runs synthetic test and verifies visibility as part of PR gating.
